Are you a #Freelance #iOS #Cocoa #Swift #developer and a fluent or native English speaker? Connect with illumineX CEO Gary W. Longsine and follow illumineX on LinkedIn. We would like to chat with you, if you're seeking novel opportunities and challenging projects.

My boss called me in his office. I was super happy. I thought he finally recognized the great job I was doing. Instead he told me I was not good enough. He said I asked too many questions and I think too much. I needed to get in line like the other employees and it seemed I was not a good fit for the company.
His words came at me like a ton of bricks. I was shattered.
This happened many years ago but if I saw him today, I would like to thank him. He taught me everything Leadership is not.
I promised myself, I would never micromanage or surround myself with "yes" employees like he did.
Check out the Most Liked post on LinkedIn for 2017 with 259,000+ likes.
So if you didn’t get the job, business deal or you were fired, always remember:
* You Weren't Rejected...You Were Divinely Redirected.
* Sometimes your best lessons come from your worse teachers.

summary: Entrepreneur computer geek with a penchant for starting software companies.  Deep experience in architecting effective and performant Enterprise Mobile Solutions. Particularly interested in Agile Development and managing teams of top-notch developers creating cutting edge mobile applications and large interactive systems.  I'm  officially CEO and Alpha Geek at CodeFab in NYC. I started my coding career at NASA, moved to Wall Street trading systems and as an incurable entrepreneur, have been a founder of a number of start-ups, including Objective Technologies, ThoughtPort, Medialets and CodeFab. I've has been a speaker at technology summits and on radio shows, and have actively participated in numerous international conferences speaking on enterprise mobile development and security.I've just spent a year as a Senior Managing Mobile Architect/Consultant for IBM in their new Apple+IBM MobileFirst team, where I was the senior suite architect for Government & HealthCare.  In addition to working on our mobile applications, I also authored the IBM Swift Style Guide, helped shape the internal Swift and iOS trying programs and worked closely with the teams developing the server-side toolset for building the back ends of our mobile applications.In addition to recently being a senior architect/engineer on the iOS HBO GO team (reimagining how we consume video entertainment), Barnes&Noble iOS Nook team (reimagining how we read), and Apple Online Store team (reimagining how we shop), I also have over 15 years of trading systems development on Wall Street as a senior IT officer. I strongly feel that the transformation of our lives by the rise of mobile computing has just started, and much interesting work lies ahead.  Specialties: Mobile architecture, engineering and user experience, enterprise scale systems integration, bluetooth and other wireless communication and control technologies.
